body:
Jump to

  • What is enhanced conversion tracking?
  • What do I need to set up enhanced conversion tracking for custom currencies in Google Tag Manager?
  • How do I set up enhanced conversion tracking for custom currencies in Google Tag Manager?

What is enhanced conversion tracking?

Enhanced conversion tracking helps you better understand the context of each conversion recorded by your SmartPixel such as associated order values, order IDs, or user IDs. You can then view conversion and custom data by pulling a granular conversion report. To learn more about how enhanced conversion tracking works, click here.

What do I need to set up enhanced conversion tracking for custom currencies in Google Tag Manager?

To set up enhanced conversion tracking through Google Tag Manager (GTM), you need:

  • A Google Tag Manager account
  • An active SmartPixel
  • A conversion segment
  • A prepared enhanced conversion tracking script

If your SmartPixel is not already active, click here to learn how to get started with GTM then return to this article.

Defining a conversion segment identifies the page on your website that represents a success, and is essential to being able to set up enhanced conversion tracking. Typically, conversion segments can be defined using URL segmentation.

To pass back revenue and additional conversion data, you will need to update the following script with the variable name associated with each value you want to pass back.

Replace X, Y, W, and Z with:

  • X: your system's variable name for order values
  • Y: your currency
  • W and Z: the variable names for any additional custom values that you want us to track. If you only want to track order values, delete this line.

How do I set up enhanced conversion tracking for custom currencies in Google Tag Manager?

Before you start:

  • Make sure you've activated your SmartPixel in GTM.
  • Prepare your enhanced conversion tracking script as instructed, here.

Adding your prepared enhanced conversion tracking script to GTM:

1. Log into your GTM account.

2. Assuming you already activated your SmartPixel in GTM, you should already have a container associated with your website URL. Ours is "www.adroll.com". Click on your website URL to open the container.

3. Enhanced conversion tracking needs to be created in its own tag. Click "Add a new tag".

4. Name your tag, something that will help you recognize what the tag is for, such as "AdRoll Enhanced Conversion Tracking". Next, choose "Custom HTML Tag" and "Continue".

5. In the HTML field that appears, enter your prepared enhanced conversion tracking script. "Continue".

6. You want your enhanced conversion tracking tag to only fire on your conversion page. Select "Some Pages".

7. If you've previously defined your conversion page, select other. Otherwise, click "New".

8. Here you will define your conversion page, similar to how you defined your conversion segment in your AdRoll dashboard.

  • Name: Conversion
  • Variable: Page URL
  • Operation: contains
  • Value: Your conversion page URL or URL pattern

9. Click "Create Tag" to save.
name: Enhanced Conversion Tracking in Google Tag Manager (Custom Currencies)
title: Enhanced Conversion Tracking in Google Tag Manager (Custom Currencies)
